member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderOptions.LogSeverityLevel
member.summary: The maximum level of the logs to write.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderOptions.LogFilePath
member.summary: A path to a file to write logs to. If this is not empty, all logs will be redirected to it.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderOptions.IsLogEnabled
member.summary: Toggles logging. Default is on when debugging, off in release mode, this setting overrides it.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderOptions.IsFragmentedMp4Enabled
member.summary: Fragments the video into a list of individually playable blocks. This allows playback of video segments that has no end, i.e. live streaming.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderOptions.IsMp4FastStartEnabled
member.summary: Place the mp4 header at the start of the file instead of the end. This allows streaming to start before entire file is downloaded.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderOptions.IsHardwareEncodingEnabled
member.summary: Enable hardware encoding if available. This is enabled by default.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderOptions.IsLowLatencyEnabled
member.summary: Faster rendering, but can affect quality. Use when speed is more important than quality.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderOptions.IsThrottlingDisabled
member.summary: Disable throttling of video renderer. If this is disabled, all frames are sent to renderer as fast as they come. Can cause out of memory crashes.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.MouseOptions.MouseClickDetectionMode
member.summary: The mode for detecting mouse clicks. Default is Polling.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.MouseOptions.MouseClickDetectionDuration
member.summary: The duration of the dot shown where the left mouse button is pressed, in milliseconds. Default is 150.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.MouseOptions.MouseClickDetectionRadius
member.summary: The radius of the dot where the left mouse button is pressed. Default is 20.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.MouseOptions.MouseRightClickDetectionColor
member.summary: The color of the dot where the right mouse button is pressed, in hex format. Default is Yellow (#FFFF00).

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.MouseOptions.MouseClickDetectionColor
member.summary: The color of the dot where the left mouse button is pressed, in hex format. Default is Yellow (#FFFF00).

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.MouseOptions.IsMouseClicksDetected
member.summary: Display a colored dot where the left mouse button is pressed.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.MouseOptions.IsMousePointerEnabled
member.summary: Display the mouse cursor on the recording

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.AudioOptions.AudioInputDevice
member.summary: Audio input device to capture audio from. Pass null or empty string to select system default.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.AudioOptions.AudioOutputDevice
member.summary: Audio playback device to capture audio from. Pass null or empty string to select system default.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.AudioOptions.IsInputDeviceEnabled
member.summary: Enable to record system audio input (e.g. microphone)

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.AudioOptions.IsOutputDeviceEnabled
member.summary: Enable to record system audio output.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoOptions.SnapshotFormat
member.summary: Image format for snapshots. This is only used with Snapshot and Slideshow modes.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoOptions.IsFixedFramerate
member.summary: Send data to the video encoder every frame, even if it means duplicating the previous frame(s). Can fix stutter issues in fringe cases, but uses more resources.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoOptions.Quality
member.summary: Video quality. This is only used when BitrateMode is set to Quality.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoOptions.Bitrate
member.summary: Bitrate in bits per second

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoOptions.Framerate
member.summary: Framerate in frames per second.

member.name: P:ScreenRecorderLib.VideoOptions.BitrateMode
member.summary: The bitrate control mode of the video encoder. Default is Quality.

member.name: M:ScreenRecorderLib.DisplayOptions.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Select monitor to record via device name, e.g.\\.\DISPLAY1, and the rectangle to record on that monitor.

member.name: M:ScreenRecorderLib.DisplayOptions.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Select monitor to record via device name, e.g.\\.\DISPLAY1

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.BitrateControlMode.Quality
member.summary: Quality-based VBR encoding. The encoder selects the bit rate to match a specified quality level. Set Quality level in VideoOptions from 1-100. Default is 70.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.BitrateControlMode.UnconstrainedVBR
member.summary: Default is unconstrained variable bitrate. Overall bitrate will average towards the Bitrate property, but can fluctuate greatly over and under it.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.BitrateControlMode.CBR
member.summary: Constant bitrate. Faster encoding than VBR, but produces larger files with consistent size. This setting might not work on software encoding.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderMode.Snapshot
member.summary: Make a snapshot of the screen.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderMode.Slideshow
member.summary: Record one PNG picture for each frame.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.RecorderMode.Video
member.summary: Record as mp4 video in h264 format.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.MouseDetectionMode.Hook
member.summary: Use a low level system hook for detecting mouse clicks. Works more reliably for programmatic events, but can negatively affect mouse performance while recording.

member.name: F:ScreenRecorderLib.MouseDetectionMode.Polling
member.summary: Use polling for detecting mouse clicks. Does not affect mouse performance, but may not work for all mouse clicks generated programmatically.

members.member: Finalize must be called even when Initialize() is failed

@param resampleInputBytes input buffer bytes of Resample(). this arg is used to calculate expected output buffer size @param sampleData_return [out] set fresh (its data shold not be allocated yet) WWMFSampleData instance as this arg
@bytes buffer bytes. must be smaller than approx. 512KB to convert 44100Hz to 192000Hz

If this instance is not empty, rhs content is concatenated to this instance. rhs remains untouched. If this instance is empty, rhs content moves to this instance. rhs becomes empty. rhs.Release() must be called to release memory either way!
@param aData must point new[] ed memory address
WWMFSampleData contains new[] ed byte buffer pointer(data) and buffer size(bytes).
sample data type. int or float it is compatible to WWBitFormatType on WasapiUser.h
